overview: This schema standardizes key economic, legal, and structural terms from a Master Credit Agreement exhibit into a tabular format. It captures parties, facility details, interest rate mechanics, maturity and repayment features, governing law, and ancillary provisions such as fees, prepayment options, covenants, and default events. Repeating concepts like multiple credit facilities, fee types, covenants, and notice rules are modeled as arrays of objects for full flexibility. Each field is based solely on text observable in the agreement. The schema omits generic EDGAR metadata and focuses on facts critical for downstream quantitative and legal analyses.

fields.name: effective_date
fields.description: The date on which the agreement becomes effective.
fields.rationale: Enables timeline analyses and linking to other instruments.

fields.name: parties
fields.description: List of contracting entities and their roles.
fields.rationale: Identifies obligations and rights assigned to each party.

fields.name: facility_terms
fields.description: Details of each credit facility provided under the agreement.
fields.rationale: Captures principal amounts, currencies, durations, and amortization for risk and pricing analysis.

fields.name: governing_law
fields.description: Jurisdiction whose laws govern the interpretation of the agreement.
fields.rationale: Determines applicable legal regime and venue for disputes.

fields.name: choice_of_forum
fields.description: Designated forum or venue for resolving disputes under the agreement.
fields.rationale: Specifies the agreed court or arbitration forum.

fields.name: fee_provisions
fields.description: All fees payable under the agreement, including commitment and facility fees.
fields.rationale: Analyzes cost structure and fee income for the lender.

fields.name: prepayment_provisions
fields.description: Terms governing optional or mandatory prepayments of principal.
fields.rationale: Impacts cash flow modeling and penalty assessments.

fields.name: covenants
fields.description: Borrower covenants and obligations specified in the agreement.
fields.rationale: Used to monitor compliance and trigger events of default.

fields.name: events_of_default
fields.description: Events or conditions that constitute a default under the agreement.
fields.rationale: Identifies triggers for lender remedies and acceleration.

fields.name: notices
fields.description: Procedures for delivering contractual notices to each party.
fields.rationale: Ensures enforceability of communications and waivers.

fields.name: conditions_precedent
fields.description: Conditions that must be satisfied before funding of the facility.
fields.rationale: Determines when lender obligations commence and risk is assumed.

fields.name: amendment_provisions
fields.description: Rules and thresholds for amending the agreement post-closing.
fields.rationale: Defines governance for changes to material terms.

fields.name: collateral_provisions
fields.description: Descriptions of collateral securing the obligations under the agreement.
fields.rationale: Key input for secured lending analysis and recovery estimates.
